column17: ” Torreyes said via interpreter . “ I knew what was at stake and knew what I needed to do . It was very special . ” 	 Realmuto ’s two - run homer in the seventh made it a four - run advantage
column18: and he lined a bases - loaded
column19: two - run single to center in the eighth . 	 Philadelphia started the comeback with five runs in the third that began with Gregorius ’ leadoff homer to deep right . Jean Segura ’s sacrifice fly
column20: Andrew McCutchen ’s double and Brad Miller ’s single also plated runs in the frame . 	 The Pirates scored five runs in the second . Starter Connor Overton
column21: in his first career at - bat
column23: two - run single that fell in between third baseman Freddy Galvis and left fielder McCutchen . Hayes followed with a three - run homer to right to make it 5 - 0 . It was 6 - 0 Pittsburgh when Moran led off the third with a long drive to right . 	 Nola settled down from that point
column24: retiring his final 12 batters . He allowed six runs on six hits with eight strikeouts and a walk in six innings . 	 “ They picked me up big time
column25: ” Nola said . “ I tried to stay in as best as possible . I just wanted to put up as many zeroes as I could . ” 	 Archie Bradley pitched a 1 - 2 - 3 seventh and José Alvarado got the first out in the eighth to make it 15 straight Pirates retired before Alvarado walked Bryan Reynolds . 	 “ We got kind of passive
column26: ” Pirates manager Derek Shelton said . “ Nola locked it in . This guy has good stuff . We have to continue to push when we get good leads . column1: BALTIMORE -- — A seemingly inconsequential game between two last - place teams provided rookie pitcher Zac Lowther an indelible memory and a morale - booster to carry with him into the offseason . 	 Lowther pitched five sparkling innings to earn his first major league victory and help the Baltimore Orioles beat the Texas Rangers 3 - 0 Thursday night . 	 Ryan Mountcastle and Austin Hays homered for the Orioles
column2: who for a change needed only a smattering of offensive punch to earn a victory . 	 After going winless with a 9.61 ERA in his first six appearances
column3: Lowther ( 1 - 2 ) got into a rhythm against the light - hitting Rangers . He allowed three hits and notched a career - high seven strikeouts in   his finest outing as a big leaguer . 	 After getting beat up by Toronto and Boston in his previous two starts
column4: Lowther got into a groove against a team vastly unlike those two AL East powerhouses . 	 “ He ’s had a couple of rough starts against teams in our division
column5: but tonight he just had way more confidence
column6: ” Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said . “ You hope he takes this into the offseason and understands he can pitch here . ” 	 The thrill of earning his first big - league win just might resonate with Lowther deep into the winter . 	 “ Every year you try to finish strong and end on a good note
column7: ” said the 25 - year - old lefty . “ Going forward
column8: it ’s a good learning moment to take into the offseason — and a confidence boost . ” 	 Tyler Wells worked the ninth to complete the five - hitter and earn his fourth save . 	 Mountcastle hit a solo shot in the fifth inning off Glenn Otto ( 0 - 3 ) for a 2 - 0 lead . Mountcastle earlier this month set the Orioles record for home runs by a rookie — eclipsing the 28 by Cal Ripken Jr. in 1982 — and leads the team with 31 homers and 84 RBI . 	 Hays went deep   in the eighth
column9: his 22nd homer of the season and eighth in September . 	 The Orioles still own the worst record in the AL ( 49 - 104 )
column10: but this was a nice start to the final homestand of a difficult season that featured a 19 - game losing streak and an alarming inability to win at Camden Yards
column11: where they 're 24 - 51 . 	 It 's been a struggle for the Rangers
column12: too . Texas ( 55 - 98 ) has lost five straight and eight of nine
column13: and appears a good bet to finish with its first 100 - loss season since 1973 . This would be only the third time the Rangers reached triple - digit defeats since the franchise moved from Washington in 1972 . 	 Manager Chris Woodward lamented his team 's shortcoming at the plate after watching Texas strand eight and go 0 for 8 with runners in scoring position . 	 “ I was a little bit frustrated . We should have done better than we did
column14: ” Woodward said . “ We did n't constantly attack the pitcher
column15: and it showed . That 's why we had a zero on the board . ” . 	 Otto gave up two runs and five hits with seven strikeouts in five innings . It was his fifth start since coming to Texas in the July 29 trade that sent Joey Gallo to the Yankees . 	 K TIME 	 Lowther and Otto entered with no wins between them
column16: and each had an ERA in excess of 9 . Yet
column17: both struck out the side in the first inning
column18: and Lowther set a new career high with two more strikeouts in the second . Not to be outdone
column19: Otto also fanned two batters in the bottom half . 	 ROOKIE RACE 	 Two of the leading candidates for AL Rookie of the Year honors are participating in this four - game series . Texas OF Adolis Garcia came in batting .243 with 30 HRs
column21: his 14 assists were second - most among big league outfielders . 	 Mountcastle was at .258
column22: and his homer put him ahead of Garcia in homers and RBI . 	 Tampa Bay OF Randy Arozarena ( .271
column24: 65 ) has the advantage of playing for a first - place club
column25: but Woodward believes Garcia 's defense is the difference - maker . 	 “ He ’s made big - time plays time and time again in big moments
column26: ” Woodward said . “ That should be worth a little bit more . ” 	 Garcia is more interested in finishing strong than garnering votes from baseball writers . 	 “ Those are things I ca n’t control
column27: ” he said through an interpreter . “ I ’m just trying to get things done on the field . ” 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Orioles : INF Ramón Urias is done for the season after being placed on the 10 - day IL on Wednesday with a right adductor strain . ... OF Anthony Santander ( hamstring ) is a “ day or two away ” from returning and is “ going to be sore probably for the rest of the year
column28: ” Hyde said . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rangers : Right - hander Spencer Howard ( 0 - 4
column29: 6.86 ERA ) tries again to get into the win column on Friday night . It will be his 14th start and 18th appearance in 2021 . 	 Orioles : Rookie left - hander Alexander Wells ( 1 - 3

column1: MINNEAPOLIS -- — The Toronto Blue Jays were relieved when surging left fielder Lourdes Gurriel Jr. escaped a freak play in the outfield without serious injury . 	 Now they 've got some hard work ahead of them to return to the postseason . 	 Nick Gordon drove in four runs and Michael Pineda won his third straight start as the Minnesota Twins beat Toronto 7 - 2 on Thursday night to bump the Blue Jays back in the AL wild - card race . 	 “ Well

The Red Sox ( 88 - 65 ) and Yankees ( 86 - 67 ) were idle . Seattle ( 84 - 69 ) pulled within one game of Toronto ( 85 - 68 ) and two of New York by beating Oakland ( 82 - 71 ) .
